bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, September 5, 1901
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

keywords.term: New York, New York, United States

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: ACKNOWLEDGED OCT 13 1901 Bureau of Foreign Commerce.

div1.p: No. 77. Consular. Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, September 5, 1901.

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D OCT 7 '01 DEPT. OF STATE

div1.p: Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State Washington.
Subject. Brighter outlook for American trade in Liberia.

Synopsis. Messers Yates and Porterfield of New York city have engaged business houses on Water Street, Monrovia, expecting to open up an American house in this city as soon as the goods can be transported from New York.
